page.title: 07THE ABBOT'S WAY
page.content: { The Abbot's Way}is a very famous trackway which runs across the {Somerset levels}from{Burtle}to {Westhay.}It was discovered in 1835 when peat cutters were working in the area. It was named the Abbot's Way because at Burtle there had been a priory in{Medieval}days and at Westhay there were monastic buildings. The Abbot's fish house still exists. However radio carbon dating techniques have established that the track dates back to before medieval times and Abbots! Such techniques show the Abbot's Way to have been built around{2500 BC.} In the year 2500 BC the area was very wet and marshy. The "villages" of Westhay and Burtle were built on slightly higher ground. It is believed that the farmers and hunters who lived on the islands of Burtle and
